form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of South Carolina introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to harmonize the definition of employee with the common law.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Modern Worker Empowerment Act.

section.header: Amendments to the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to harmonize the definition of employee

subsection.text: Section 3(e)(1) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203(e)(1)) is amended by inserting before the period the following: , as determined under the usual common law rules.
Section 3(g) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203(g)) is amended by inserting an employee after permit.
